barovian_time: Day 1-2: Eyule 14th - 15th, year 735 of Barovian Calendar
location: Eastern Barovian Gate
summary: - The characters stop to rest at the Witches Teat tavern, where they meet York the barman and Lungari, a vistani wine merchant on his way to Barovia - Lungari hearing their destination employes them as an escort - In the morning they make their way through the local forest, defend the wolf attack, loosing their donkey in the process; while the mists start to rise, Lungari hurries the party towards the Gates of Barovia - Evening comes and the party arrive at the gates - there they make acquintance with Lungari‚Äôs friends, Zintori and other 2 members of a Vallaki Vistani clan; they camp, tell storries, sing songs, eat and drink as guests of the Vistani - Unfortunately, the food and drink were drugged - only Tuka remains semi-concsious to realize the party are the target of robbery - all of their posessions (not on them) taken, including weapons and provisions and left tied to fend for themselves, while Zintori, Lungari and friends escape to Barovia - While on their bellies, the party is ambushed by a familiar wolf pack - many more in numbers - defenceless they barely survive the attack, while being greeted by a giant DIre Wolf who speaks to the party with human tongue - taunting them and inviting to step into the gates and into his domain - The party run through the gates, while they crash behind them; mists envelope the wall and gates and in front of them - decaying old svalich road leading west through the Svalich woods. - **200XP each** already distributed *(50XP x 4 wolves defeated; 50XP x 12 wolves surviving / 2 + 600XP bandit captain Zentori and gang / 2 + 200XP finding and entering the Barovia = 200XP + 300XP + 300XP + 200XP = 1000XP)*

barovian_time: Day 2: Eyule 15th, year 735 of Barovian Calendar (morning - late afternoon)
location: Eastern Barovian Gate; Death House 3rd floor (mid point between village of Barovia and the Eastern Barovian Gate)
summary: - The party run through the gates, while they crash behind them; mists envelope the wall and gates and in front of them - decaying old svalich road leading west through the Svalich woods; one is missing from their ranks - Castor, consumed by the mist forever - The party orient themselves and start salvaging and moving Westward - On their way they find a mangled body of a man, dead for several days - a letter on him tells them to stay clear of Barovia and that his daughter is being attacked by a fiend, a vampyre and is in dire need of rescue, signed by Kolyan Indirovich, burgomaster of the village of Barovia - As they hear wolves howling nearing their location, they decide to run for it - at some point they find a crossroad - with a trail leading to the North - they decide to check that location and find a mansion that seems to be populated, with sounds of dinner and lights from the foggy windows - As they enter the mansion, soon they realize they are trapped by the mists and there are no leaving souls inside, but the rats in the walls. They traverse the 1st and 2nd floors w/o any major setbacks - They find out that the mansion is owned by nobles - Durst family; they find out they had 2 smaller children - a girl and a boy; and also a newborn child - After finding a secret room behind the library, they realize the Durst family were into occult and strange sacrificial rituals; but also that they worshipped Strahd himself - something Strahd tried dissuade them from with a not so pleasant letter - They find a bloodstain in the servants room undre the bed - indicating something sinister happened there - They follow the lead to the 3rd floor - where the delapidation starts to be more pronounced - the furniture is decaying, cobwebs covering the walls, no active lights - they are ambushed by a set of armor, similar to the ones they seen on the 2nd floor, but this one alive and seeking the party‚Äôs demise - **200XP each** already distributed *(100XP finding the burgomaster‚Äôs servant body + 200XP successfully navigating and avoiding danger on the Svalich Road - i.e. escaped dire wolf encounter + 100XP finding the Death House + 200XP finding secret room on the 2nd floor of the Death House + 200XP animated armor defeated = 800XP)* - Total so far: 400XP / character

barovian_time: Day 2-3: Eyule 15th-16th, year 735 of Barovian Calendar (night)
location: Death House 3rd floor/Attic > Death House Catacombs
summary: - The party takes a break to level up on the 3rd floor - Tinkertop is transferred to a different floor by the malice of the House - They also see a crying nursemaid ghost and a package looking like a baby roll that Zerio takes with him - The party regroup, find some treasure and then run for their lives from another animated armor through a secret door to the attic - In the attic they meet the Durst children that died of starvation in their room - they befriend them and take them (occupying 2 toys) with them - They take a short rest and Tuka inscribes his star charts to use as his arcane focus - They discover a secret staircase leading to the house catacombs - a Durst cult encampment - There they hear a clear chanting permenating the whole catacombs - There they fight 4 ghouls and decide to take a long rest in the Durst children room protected by the wards of the children‚Äôs spirits - **400XP each** already distributed *(1600XP total)* - Total so far: 800XP / character

barovian_time: Day 3: Eyule 16th, year 735 of Barovian Calendar (morning)
location: Death House Catacombs and Dungeons
summary: - The party takes a long rest in the children‚Äôs attic room - protected by the spirits of Rose and Thorn - Tuka motivates the party to see the light in this darkness and help those in need by exploring further into the dungeons and uncovering the houses secrets and defeating the evil within - The party delves deeper into the catacombs, finding living quarters of the cult as well as a well - at the bottom of it a strange otherwordly puzzle box - After figuring it out, inside they find an undead black cat that becomes the party‚Äôs familiar - and it‚Äôs totem an otherwordly strange tiara - Following the cultists chants the party barely escaping a pit trap, they are attacked by a swarm of centipedes; escaping the swarm, they decide to explore before unexplored space from last session only to encounter an angry grick - they defeat it - After descending into the dungeons - the chants become very loud and clear ‚ÄúHe is the ancient! He is the Land!‚Äù; they explore the further into the prison and find a secret door into the ritual chamber - on a ritual dias they find bones of a child (Walter) that was sacrificed by the cult to the Beast - The party refuses to make the sacrifice to the Beast, the Beast awakens and attacks the party - the party comes out victorious

barovian_time: Day 3: Eyule 16th, year 735 of Barovian Calendar (late afternoon)
location: Village of Barovia, Blood on the Vine tavern
summary: - The party refuses to make the sacrifice to the Beast, the Beast awakens and attacks the party - the party comes out victorious - The party make their way back to the house level of the house - the house awakens and attacks the party with all of its might - the party miraculously escape the house and its mists - The party takes a rest to give a proper burial to Walter, Rose and Thorn Durst - The party reach the Village of Barovia by mid-day and see the effects of living under the shadow of castle Ravenloft and its ruler, Strahd the devil, it‚Äôs not a big secret that Strahd is a bloodsucking monster that feeds upon the villagers - They also visit the Mad Mary and discover about her 2 daughters - one disapearing a year ago in the Svailich woods, and one just several days ago, Gertruda, a protected child who wasn‚Äôt allowed out of the house a lot out of fear; they obtain her Blinsky doll and are asked to lookout for Gertruda and give her the doll and ask her to come back to her mama - They meet Perriwimple and Bildrath of Bildrath mercantile - realizing that he has stuff that was stolen from the party by the band of Vistani in the 1st session; they also realize that Bildrath prices are exuberant - Back in the streets they meet an old lady (Morgantha) selling the pies - Zerio desides to try one and gains positive effects of euphoria (+1 to all ability modifiers) - this will last only a day, when the hangover will revert his ability modifiers to -1 until another pie is eaten or a CON save that can be made once per day; Morgantha also shares the party the rest of the pie, but a local woman jumps at the party and begs for it - they party decides to part with it, seeing that they are being surrounded by other villagers that are not very friendly - In the Blood on the Vine tavern they meet the bartender Arik, get the price list and order food and bedroom for a couple of SP, they talk to the owners - 3 Vistana women who are not too keen on the visitors; and lastly they meet Ismark Kolyanovich who tells them the story of adventurers and villagers who ambushed Strahd but were killed (except one) and how his father was driven to death by Strahd because he didn‚Äôt stop these adventurers; burgomaster is now dead and his daughter is being hunted by Strahd - Ismark asks the party to protect his sister Ireena and give a proper burial to his father Kolyan Iindirovich

barovian_time: Day 4: Eyule 17th, year 735 of Barovian Calendar (morning)
location: Village of Barovia, Barovian cemetery
summary: - In the Blood on the Vine tavern of the village of Barovia, the party meet Ismark Kolyanovich, the burgomasters son - they promise to help him protect his sister Ireena and give a proper burial to his father Kolyan Iindirovich. - Meanwhile Tinkertop explores the inside of the fold-space of the Cat Tiara - inside it befriends the 8-legged 500kg black feline - true form of the Cat. - The party follows Ismark and meet with his sister, Ireena Kolyana, mourning along the dead body of their father. - Tuka attunes to the Cat Tiara and summons both the Cat and Tinkertop from its depths. Tinkertop emerges missing his arm - he severed due to incredible pain caused by a curse from his previous life. - The mansion is attacked by a pack of wolves - the party are able to fight them back. - The part spend the night and help Kolyan family to bring their father‚Äôs body to the Church, where they meet Father Donovich - praying and grieving - his son, Doru, screaming uncontrollably from the Undercroft of the Church - turned to vampire spawn a year ago, he wasn‚Äôt fed by Donovich since then; trying to find remedy for his condition. - They bring the body to the cemetery - Kolyan‚Äôs tomb ready for his burial. - A dark carriage pulls to the gates of the cemetery during the ceremony - stepping out a dusk elf and his master - a gentlemen in noble black dress, Strahd himself; summoning Ireena (‚ÄùTatyana, come with me!..‚Äù) to follow him to the castle; the party stop this, and Strahd leaves; but he summons a pack of his zombies to scare off the party - he materializes an invitation letter on one of their bodies for the party to find, in case they survive and continue their travels with Ireena - an attempt to get closer to them but also a ruse to bring Ireena with them - **the berry doesn‚Äôt permiate magic energy**; anything **lower** and the land corrupts this edible - the berries turn out **black and clearly rotten** *(and if consumed they make you throw up, reduce your HP by 1 and require you to eat soon or gain a level of exhaustion)*

The food can go bad - roll on 1d4 - 1d12 (depending on the quality of preservation) if it makes sense, on 1 it goes bad and is unsuitable to eat 3. Add comfort of the downtime rules: - suffer penalties, in case no quarter = cannot take effect of long rest in bad weather, can use only 1 downtime instead of 2 during long rest in any weather - use your background to find appropriate place (e.g. a temple, farmstead, noble) - roll to find one such place (DC15 appropriate skill, e.g. survival, charisma/social, wisdom, intellect - roll once per party) - *basic (usually 1SP/day) for basic living, most of the standard rooms has this (no bonuses or penalties)* - *comfortable (usually 1gp/day) for fine living (you can gain effects of one downtime for free)* - *luxureous (usually 5GP/day) for noble living (gain 2 luck points in the beginning of the day; then select:* - *you can gain effects of one downtime for free and recover all your HP* - *OR gain effects of one downtime for free and fully recover HD* - *OR roll to gain a social asset, e.g. favor with an NPC w/o using your downtime* 4. barovian_time: Day 7: Eyule 20th (noon) - Day 8: Eyule 21st (midnight), year 735 of Barovian Calendar
location: Vallaki Vistani Camp > Main Square > Blue Water Inn > Church of St. Andral > Streets of Vallaki
summary: - As the party reunites in the woods near the vistani camp, they note that they are beeing watched - by a mysterious pale figure among the trees. - They meet Kasimir Velikov, a dust elf, previously of druids of the Fanes; he tells his and Barovia‚Äôs story and asks the party to help him travel to the Amber Temple where he wants to find a power that would allow him to ressurrect his sister Patrina Velikovna (imprisoned in the crypst of the Ravenloft castle) and destroy Strahd - **Kasimir**, a mutiliated and grief-stricken dusk elf. His people were on the verge of being annihilated by Strahd's armies when they surrendered. Strahd left the few survivors to the mercy of the Vistani / His people were the protectors of the land, one with nature and the stars, they were tending tending the Starry Fanes that allowed the land to prosper - with it‚Äôs lush forests and wildlife, as well as farm lands. The land was ruled by many, but Tsergs were last before Strahds‚Äô armies marched in and destroyed all that is good. - There are still druids of the fanes in the wild - remains of what was - they are all insane now, worshipping Strahd, as the land itself- - nonsence. - Strahd does have the power over these lands only because he aligned with Dark Powers of the Amber Citadel, defiled the fanes and stole the Starry Crystals on their behest. - He knows that the star crystal protected by the Dusk Elves was taken by Strahd and now is probably in the castle Ravenloft - stolen from the dusk elves // there are other 2 that were protected by the order of the feather and the order of the silver dragon (doesn‚Äôt know about the other 2 crystals held by the wereravens) - He tells them about the Vallaki Vistani - the plotting Arigail and Zintori against Luvash / he‚Äôs not totally in alingmnet with the current leadership (Luvash), but anything‚Äôs better than that Zintori, lackeys of Strahd - The party leave Vallaki Vistani Camp and find Luvash overwatching the grazing of the horses with Arabelle and Alexeii, to tell him what they know about Zintori and Arigail, Luvash first sceptical, sees some truth in the words and heeds well (avoids any plotting by reenforcing his guards and sending away Arigail - who‚Äôs currently on a mission) - They go to the Main Square - where the meet the burgomaster (Vargas), his wife and his lackeys - preparing for the Festival of the Blazing Sun, he thinks it would bring excitement to burn some of the prisoners at the wicker man - Tuka steps in and tries to dessuad the burgomaster as it seems to be a bad idea - Burgomaster laughs the suggestion off, saying that it was only a joke - At the Walpoles book store they find interesting information on wizards of the land, trade in books (Zerio buys a book on cooking) - At the Leatherworks they find interesting offers on sale of raw materials (e.g., hides), warm clothes and equipment, buy some armor and order a glamoured studded leather - At the Martikovs Blue Water Inn, they try to talk and follow the ravens - they do understand some of these are wereravens - but are unable to persuade them to show themselves - they follow the one raven to the Church - where Tuka turns into a small lizard - one of the ravens at the top of the belltower thinks him food, grabs him and brings him over to the Blue Water Inn cellar raven purch to its nest (with nesting children) - upon impact though, Tuka looses his form and transforms back to human and smashes some of the chicks. Urwin Martikov encounters this situation and asks Tuka to leave now as he is grievened by the death of the ravens. - Tuka comes back to the Church and the rest of the party go to meet him - on their way to each other, Tuka is ambushed by dark figures - fight ensues, the party tries to run; however one of the poisoned bolts render Zerio unconcious - he is grabbed by the hooded parties; while a voice from atop of the roof screams ‚ÄúReturn the bones or you will never see your friend again!‚Äù (Zintori) ![image.png](image%201.png) - **Hooks and Fronts (including potential**

location: Streets of Vallaki > Church of St. Andral > Main Square > St. Andral Abbey Inn

Unconscious Zintori is gagged, tied up and brought to the 2nd floor of the St. Andral Inn outside of Vallaki near the Abbey of St. Andral. - Tuka and Wael send the Tiara Cat to follow Zerio gang and report back / Wael sends a familiar owl imbued with a message to Luvash > Zerio was abducted by Zintori and held against the laws of Vistani - Zerio wakes up blinded, gagged and tied behind his back hands and foot; someone‚Äôs in the room > Zerio decides to take a nap to level up - In the morning Tuka and Wael spend time to find appropriate skull to disguise as that of St. Andrals, they gain access to cosmetics from Father Petrovich to conceal it‚Äôs imperfections and bring its look closer of that of the saints bones - Zerio wakes up alone in the room, sounds of a party going on below his location, bell is tolling nearby; after several tries he releases one of his legs; his prisoner sometimes visits to check on him but he keeps his disguise - Tuka and Wael split up - Wael visits the **Skran‚Äôs Leather and Hides** (Leatherworker and Leather Goods) at the main square - there he receives his new Glamoured Studded Leather Armor (winter clothes; resistance against piercing) and witnesses the uneasy festivities of the town - Festival of the Blazing Sun is in full motion - as Baron Vallakovich tries to set the wicker sun and man on fire, it starts raining and his torch is blown out - one of the militia man (Southern gate guard) laughs out loud and receives a cruel punishment - his body is tied up behind the Barons horse and dragged through the streets. location: Vallaki (Main Square Leatherworker) > Vallaki (Wachterhouse)
summary: - The party decided to spend the rest of the day in the Skrans leathers and hides - replenishing their strength and deciding on their strategy - The party take an alternative approach - they decide to go for the Wachterhouse and try to sieze lady Wachters children and leverage them in the negotiations - They gain entry into the house w/o being noticed also due to a strong storm outside - Inside they find Cellar - pentagram, signs of a macabre ritual, 4 dead cultists sitted at the ends of the star - They investigate the rest of the house and find the following: - Golden goblet (250gp) - taken by Wael - Stella Wachter - insane daughter of the Wachter, imagining her to be a cat >> fed and freed from her captivity by Tuka, now roams the house - Bones of Leo Dilisnya (one of enemies of Strahd, and claimants to the Barovian lands) - Nikolai Senior Wachter, lady Wachters late husband - dead and preserved in the masters bedroom - Cats of the Wachterhouse library - Treasure of the secret storage: 180ep, 110gp, old wooden pipe, 5 scrolls notirized deeds for parcels of land (given by Strahd to Wachters 4 centuries ago), supple leather case, Grimoire of the Four Quarters (Devostas; forgery about demonology; the real one is in the Amber Temple) - Old letter to Lady Lovina Wachter - from Lord Vasili von Holtz, thanking Lovina for her hospitality and friendship (Strahd's handwriting) - Karl and Nikolai Wachter - tied and siezed and fairly scared and hungover - **Rudolph/Rictavio** holds detailed notes on vampire hunting - combining these with what Zerio noted from Strahd‚Äôs Diary will reveal all of Strahd‚Äôs weaknesses, combat strategies and strenghts; as well as which items are essential to defeath him (i.e., the items of power from the reading; etc.) - (at least 3 downtimes with arcana/INT check of 15) - they will gain critical information about different monster types, including Strahd - Rictavio/Rudolph will also tell that Strahd is not a usual vampire, as he‚Äôs also a powerful spellcaster - having learnt his wizardry from a powerful lich >> it can provide with additional stats - The party hides the Yester Hill Start Crystal deep underground - under the cellar of the winery - Argynvostholt can reveal locations of all the fanes of Barovia (Berez; Bonegrinder; Krezk) and Revenants know the location of the 3rd **star crystal in the Amber Temple!!** (other 2: castle Ravenloft; Yester Hill) - If the party restore the beacon of light > it will shing across the land giving hope, but they will lose the revenants; but also it will reduce Strahd‚Äôs and dark powers hold on certain locations > mainly Vallaki will be free of lady Wachter‚Äôs undead that she will summon using Strahd‚Äôs book of death she received during their Dinner at castle Ravenloft ([Dinner with Strahd](https://www.notion.so/Dinner-with-Strahd-103263699129800dbb51d9ee709b0044?pvs=21)) / Zerio‚Äôs silver dragon shield should become Animated Shield, carried in the past by Argynvost himself - Although the mountains prevent the beacon's light from reaching Castle Ravenloft directly, Strahd can see the light's glow in the sky to the west. The beacon can be seen in Vallaki (*chapter 5*), Krezk (*chapter 8*), and Berez (*chapter 10*), as well as from Old Bonegrinder (*chapter 6*), Van Richten's Tower (*chapter 11*), and the werewolf den (*chapter 15*). The beacon's light can be "felt" even by creatures that are blind. The light allows good-aligned creatures to experience glimmers of hope and joy, while evil creatures find the light disconcerting. - ***Beacon of Protection.*** While the beacon shines, characters and other creatures that oppose Strahd gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws for as long as they remain in Barovia. - ***Revenants at Rest.*** **Vladimir Horngaard** and the other revenants that haunt Barovia see the light as a reminder of all that was once good and noble about the knightly order to which they once belonged. They let go of their hatred and their corporeal bodies, leaving corpses behind as their spirits find rest at long last. Henceforth, any random encounter with a revenant should be treated as no encounter. - By restoring the fanes to power including the Argynvostholt beacon > permanent overcast above Barovia dissipades > Everyone can see the moon, stars and sun now > Vampires do not have the power to walk the land in the daylight now and will be destroyed in the daylight - **Ezmeralda**, is on her way to the Wizard‚Äôs tower location where she continues her search for doctor Rudolph von Richter / she is destined to help the party, but she needs to find Rudolph and then based on his investigation plot her way to the Abbey of Markovia as she heard Abbot who can be a great ally > ultimately this will not go as planned, but it will reveal the Holy Symbol of Ravenkind - [Grimoire of Crimson](https://www.notion.so/Grimoire-of-Crimson-19626369912980a4856fef0721cb1fa0?pvs=21) - as the party kills hot blooded creatures it feeds the grimoire to power - Vampyr, the 1st vampire and the Dark Power that brought Barovia into Ravenloft, created this tome and through it, Vampyr seduces others to vampirism - Party found additional pages torn from the Grimoire - if put back and joined together, the Grimoire awakens as an Chaotic Evil artifact with CHA18, that will be a nuisance and will be trying magically charm the party members into doing things of hideous evil - Grimore speaks his ‚Äútruths‚Äù [Grimoire of Crimson](https://www.notion.so/Grimoire-of-Crimson-19626369912980a4856fef0721cb1fa0?pvs=21) - Obsidian Heart of the Night Spider Queen slumbering until they find a host - Witches of the Bonegrinder can scry and enter the party‚Äôs dreams (During the night some members of the party during the watch have been visited by the witches tempting them with pacts (but that's another story...) // Morgantha‚Äôs scrying (need to roll; DC23 WIS) + nightmares // They will keep away if acommpanied by Strahd, Vasili or under Strahd‚Äôs protection - **the berry doesn‚Äôt permiate magic energy**; anything **lower** and the land corrupts this edible - the berries turn out **black and clearly rotten** *(and if consumed they make you throw up, reduce your HP by 1 and require you to eat soon or gain a level of exhaustion)* 7. The food can go bad - roll on 1d4 - 1d12 (depending on the quality of preservation) if it makes sense, on 1 it goes bad and is unsuitable to eat 8. Add comfort of the downtime rules: - suffer penalties, in case no quarter = cannot take effect of long rest in bad weather, can use only 1 downtime instead of 2 during long rest in any weather - use your background to find appropriate place (e.g. a temple, farmstead, noble) - roll to find one such place (DC15 appropriate skill, e.g. survival, charisma/social, wisdom, intellect - roll once per party) - *basic (usually 1SP/day) for basic living, most of the standard rooms has this (no bonuses or penalties)* - *comfortable (usually 1gp/day) for fine living (you can gain effects of one downtime for free)* - *luxureous (usually 5GP/day) for noble living (gain 2 luck points in the beginning of the day; then select:you can gain effects of one downtime for free and recover all your HP* - *OR gain effects of one downtime for free and fully recover HD* - *OR roll to gain a social asset, e.g. favor with an NPC w/o using your downtime* 9. Add carousing and gambling from Knave 2E! 10. I have introduced the fact - if you want to change your spells for the day - you need to use the downtime 11. Use downtime to level up - regain HP total of the difference between the maximum HP of previous level and new level - **Druids of the Fanes** - protectors of the land / Corrupted druids of Barovia - land is now Strahd, they worship Strahd - **Church of the Morninglord** - pieceful but not in alignment with magic of the fanes and nature - with common enemy in Strahd - **Order of the Silver Dragon** - protectors of Barovia and its people // completely destroyed, only sullen revenants remain - **Keepers of the Feather** - eyes and ears of the Order of the Silver Dragon / Kasimir thinks they are hiding - **Dusk Elves** of Barovia - see [Kasimir Velikov (6)](https://www.notion.so/Kasimir-Velikov-6-3db6f2a052b5456b8de822d45a61f434?pvs=21) - **Pagan Tergs** were never friends of the land, but they were lesser of the evil - driven away back to the South centuries ago 6. The party discovers some grim truths about Vallaki and Barovia - the Baron Valakovich is a despot, that organizes these festivals to keep the populace in check / Izek is the captain of the Baron‚Äôs militia - a formidable and dreadful fellow - Father Petrovich is managing the St. Andral‚Äôs church - he‚Äôs been a welcoming light in the darkness that persists around Barovia - There are many orphans in the city - Toad and Jorik among them (although Toad was adopted by the Araseks) - however, many children missing in the recent time - also reenforced by the missing children posters all over the town - Vallaki Vistani leave outside the town and are not allowed inside Vallaki by the town authorities; there‚Äôs a power struggle - a coup is planned by the brother of the current leader (Arigail together with Zintori plotting against Luvash) - There were protectors of Barovia: druids of the Starry Fanes (dusk elves part of them); Order of the Silver Dragon (destroyed and left for revenants in the Argynvostholt; Keepers of the Feather (presumed still in Barovia, in hiding) 7. Arigail is being manipulated by Anastrasya as she needs to replenish the [The Fallen Scourge Vampires (6)](https://www.notion.so/The-Fallen-Scourge-Vampires-6-13b263699129808b976dc67da472c6f2?pvs=21) 8. 2xvials of Teriac (cure for the infection) [Teriac Potion](https://www.notion.so/Teriac-Potion-1a4263699129800d83a7d6fd8717b68f?pvs=21) 9. Abbey restoration (**Abbots Treasury left behind>> Three bulky, cumbersome paintings** of immense value, each worth **500 gp (cannot carry it with them).) // is Abbot himself?** 10. Doru and Father Petrovich becom Strahds agents and leave in his castle for now 11. Bluto released from his infection and addiction to the black barm ale 12. Brother Antonio / brother Bertram / The door / portal to Gorgoroth world (outside the Brewery) / treasures of the Abbey 13. Walpole sr. - the bookstore owner - offers the party to browse his bookstore / he isn‚Äôt opening up on his ‚Äúsecret library‚Äù - only after the party become good friends with him 14. Blue Water Inn and Rictavio 15. The Barovian Vistani trio are scheming to still the Cat Tiara from the party 16. *Wael: Glamoured Studded Leather: winter clothes; resistance to piercing* 17. Burgomaster‚Äôs mansion can be used as a base of operation by the party - however, if not maintained by anyone for more than a couple of days - it will be occupied by either other villagers, monsters or worse (they broken some of the windows - so squatting people or wilderness is reasonable) 18. The party‚Äôs equipment and Bildrath store and Perriwimple 19. The party (Tuka attuned to the Cat Tiara) gained a familiar black abberation cat-like creature, strange tiara and an othewordly puzzle box that come with it - the cat will follow the party and act as a familiar; if killed it will retreat into the tiara as a smoky apparation; it‚Äôs not clear what this cat is // *The box itself bleeds strong acid when manipulated to open; acid looses potency if removed from the surface of the box almost immediately (5d8 acid damage) // The tiara is the cats totem and serves as a extradimensional safe space it can escape to (the party member attuned to it, can summon it back once per day/long rest)* 20. Cat Tiara and the abomination cat 21. Some optional NPCs the party knows from their travels: ~~Piotr and Ivan (Vallaki graverobbers),~~ Petra (Tser Vistani merchant), Dossyir (Silver Dragon revenant - in wait in the Svalich Woods near the village of Barovia for the final attack on Ravenloft), sceletal rider (of Silver Dragon), Morgantha, Zentori / Lungari, etc. 22. The party has gained Ring of Warmth from Petra 23. ~~Tinkertop severed his own hand due to unimaginable pain - his plan to regrow / reforge the hand~~ 24. ~~Tinkertop vaguely knows the true nature of the cat and the magical tiara - a world of its own inside it (Astral plane)~~ 25. ~~Tinkertop disappered during the burgomaster funeral attack - stantched by Strahd himself~~ 26. ~~Castor disappered when he stepped into the mists of Ravenloft - snatched by the Dark Powers, as one with sould unpure~~

barovian_time: Day 19: 4th of Avgust (8am) - Day 20: 5th of Avgust (10am) year 735 of Barovian Calendar
location: Vallaki (Main Square Leatherworker and Streets around) > Vallaki streets > Vallaki (Burgomasters mansion) > Vallaki (Church of St. Andral)
summary: - Party decides to deal with the crab by submerging it into one of the town wells, to ensure it doesn't escape its confinement until the party is able to resolve the undead infestation - the result of lady Wachters ritual empowered by the Tome of Death - Zerio studies lady Wachters notes and discovers the way of her ritual; he investigates the Tome of Death and consults Crimson Grimoire on how to reverse the effects of the ritual / it seems undead are drown to the Tome, however if the person holding it is unatuned to it - they want to destroy the one holding it, rather than listen to their commands - He accepts the Crimson's Grimoires pact - it tells it how to dispel the ritual, while Zerio promises it fresh blood of a virgin to be fed the Grimoire within a fortnight; the Griomoire places a pact seed that will take over if the pact is not fulfilled - Party enters the Church and discovers a refugee camp maintained by father Petrovich against the undead surrounding the Church - From Ismark they discover that Ireena has been missing for 3 days - Zerio starts the dispeling ritual, while Wael and Tuka visit Burgomaster's mansion - they dipose of the Hell Hounds, release burgomasters wife and make short acquintance with Victor Vallakovich - an unruly and unpleasant son of the Baron - Also they find 2 other odd things in the mansion - Izek's room full of Blinsky toy dolls all looking like Ireena; a buduoire with a white wedding dress - The party reunites in the Church - they complete the ritual by next morning, thus saving the town from the horde of Undead - Ireena is missing - but many clues point at Izek, the former militia commander

barovian_time: Day 20: 5th of Avgust 10am - Day 21: 6th of Avgust (midnight) year 735 of Barovian Calendar
location: Vallaki (Church of St. Andral > Araseks Stockyard > Blue Water Inn > Blinsky Toys) > Old Bonegrinder
summary: - Ireena is missing - but many clues point at Izek, the former militia commander - The party convinces Izek to remain and investigate Ireena's disspaerance in town, rather than follow them along - They investigate the Araseks discovering that Izek went through the Mourning Gate during the commotion - They find their horses, luckily still alive and well - They also try asking the orphans Jorik and Rufus about Vasili - they do not know where he is exactly on business, somewhere East perhaps; they take the ruined mansion Wachterhouse as their own playground - Tuka suggests to bring all found bones to the graveyard of the Church - At Blinsky, they piss off Gadof with mind bending shenanigans, and he asks them to leave w/o dissolving any meaningful information to them - At Martikovs - they ask Sebastian and Urwin to investigate the area where Izek's cart was moving to - in a quarter of a day they got note that the cart was spotted parked near the Old Bonegrinder - At the Bonegrinder they are ambushed by the hag covenant - they defeat Sunbane and Ofelia; however, Morgantha is able to take her flying broom and escape the party after the covenant is broken - she will try to re-establish the covenant - The party is at the Bonegrinder at midnight, unfortunately they don't have much in terms of clues where Ireena is, but an old sack and 33ft of braded hempen rope.

barovian_time: Day 21: 6th of Avgust (midnight) - Day 22: 7th of Avgust (5am, prior long rest) year 735 of Barovian Calendar
location: Old Bonegrinder > Argynvostholt > Berez > Tsolenka Path > Amber Temple

The beacon can be seen in Vallaki (*chapter 5*), Krezk (*chapter 8*), and Berez (*chapter 10*), as well as from Old Bonegrinder (*chapter 6*), Van Richten's Tower (*chapter 11*), and the werewolf den (*chapter 15*). The beacon's light can be "felt" even by creatures that are blind. he investigates the Tome of Death and consults Crimson Grimoire on how to reverse the effects of the ritual / it seems undead are drown to the Tome, however if the person holding it is unatuned to it - they want to destroy the one holding it, rather than listen to their commands - He accepts the Crimson's Grimoires pact - it tells it how to dispel the ritual, while Zerio promises it fresh blood of a virgin to be fed the Grimoire within a fortnight; the Griomoire places a pact seed that will take over if the pact is not fulfilled - Party enters the Church and discovers a refugee camp maintained by father Petrovich against the undead surrounding the Church - From Ismark they discover that Ireena has been missing for 3 days - Zerio starts the dispeling ritual, while Wael and Tuka visit Burgomaster's mansion - they dipose of the Hell Hounds, release burgomasters wife and make short acquintance with Victor Vallakovich - an unruly and unpleasant son of the Baron - Also they find 2 other odd things in the mansion - Izek's room full of Blinsky toy dolls all looking like Ireena; a buduoire with a white wedding dress - The party reunites in the Church - they complete the ritual by next morning, thus saving the town from the horde of Undead - Ireena is missing - but many clues point at Izek, the former militia commander - **Ireena dissapeared** - she was last seen by some being hauled by the captain of militia Izek > he escaped and is now hiding with her at the Bonegrinder in pact with the hags - Burgomasters mansion - burgomasters wife and son Victor - Wachterhouse burnt to a crisp - cat infestation around the neighborhood - Karl and Nikolai Wachter + Stella Wachter - Bones in the chest from Wachterhouse - Old letter to Lady Lovina Wachter from Vasili von Holtz - Bones of Leo Dilisnya and body of Nikolai Wachter sr. - **Vasili desapeared**, seamingly out of town - **Rudolph/Rictavio** holds detailed notes on vampire hunting - combining these with what Zerio noted from Strahd‚Äôs Diary will reveal all of Strahd‚Äôs weaknesses, combat strategies and strenghts; as well as which items are essential to defeath him (i.e., the items of power from the reading; etc.) - (at least 3 downtimes with arcana/INT check of 15) - they will gain critical information about different monster types, including Strahd - Rictavio/Rudolph will also tell that Strahd is not a usual vampire, as he‚Äôs also a powerful spellcaster - having learnt his wizardry from a powerful lich >> it can provide with additional stats - The party hides the Yester Hill Start Crystal deep underground - under the cellar of the winery - Argynvostholt can reveal locations of all the fanes of Barovia (Berez; Bonegrinder; Krezk) and Revenants know the location of the 3rd **star crystal in the Amber Temple!!** (other 2: castle Ravenloft; Yester Hill) - If the party restore the beacon of light > it will shing across the land giving hope, but they will lose the revenants; but also it will reduce Strahd‚Äôs and dark powers hold on certain locations > mainly Vallaki will be free of lady Wachter‚Äôs undead that she will summon using Strahd‚Äôs book of death she received during their Dinner at castle Ravenloft ([Dinner with Strahd](https://www.notion.so/Dinner-with-Strahd-103263699129800dbb51d9ee709b0044?pvs=21)) / Zerio‚Äôs silver dragon shield should become Animated Shield, carried in the past by Argynvost himself - Although the mountains prevent the beacon's light from reaching Castle Ravenloft directly, Strahd can see the light's glow in the sky to the west. The beacon can be seen in Vallaki (*chapter 5*), Krezk (*chapter 8*), and Berez (*chapter 10*), as well as from Old Bonegrinder (*chapter 6*), Van Richten's Tower (*chapter 11*), and the werewolf den (*chapter 15*). The beacon's light can be "felt" even by creatures that are blind. The light allows good-aligned creatures to experience glimmers of hope and joy, while evil creatures find the light disconcerting. - ***Beacon of Protection.*** While the beacon shines, characters and other creatures that oppose Strahd gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws for as long as they remain in Barovia. - ***Revenants at Rest.*** **Vladimir Horngaard** and the other revenants that haunt Barovia see the light as a reminder of all that was once good and noble about the knightly order to which they once belonged. They let go of their hatred and their corporeal bodies, leaving corpses behind as their spirits find rest at long last. Henceforth, any random encounter with a revenant should be treated as no encounter. - By restoring the fanes to power including the Argynvostholt beacon > permanent overcast above Barovia dissipades > Everyone can see the moon, stars and sun now > Vampires do not have the power to walk the land in the daylight now and will be destroyed in the daylight - **Ezmeralda**, is on her way to the Wizard‚Äôs tower location where she continues her search for doctor Rudolph von Richter / she is destined to help the party, but she needs to find Rudolph and then based on his investigation plot her way to the Abbey of Markovia as

Brother Antonio / brother Bertram / The door / portal to Gorgoroth world (outside the Brewery) / treasures of the Abbey 13. Walpole sr. - the bookstore owner - offers the party to browse his bookstore / he isn‚Äôt opening up on his ‚Äúsecret library‚Äù - only after the party become good friends with him 14. The party‚Äôs equipment and Bildrath store and Perriwimple 19. as well as which items are essential to defeath him (i.e., the items of power from the reading; etc.) - (at least 3 downtimes with arcana/INT check of 15) - they will gain critical information about different monster types, including Strahd - Rictavio/Rudolph will also tell that Strahd is not a usual vampire, as he‚Äôs also a powerful spellcaster - having learnt his wizardry from a powerful lich >> it can provide with additional stats - The party hides the Yester Hill Star Crystal deep underground - under the cellar of the winery - Argynvostholt can reveal locations of all the fanes of Barovia (Berez; Bonegrinder; Krezk) and Revenants know the location of the 3rd **star crystal in the Amber Temple!!** (other 2: castle Ravenloft; Yester Hill) - If the party restore the beacon of light > it will shing across the land giving hope, but they will lose the revenants; but also it will reduce Strahd‚Äôs and dark powers hold on certain locations > mainly Vallaki will be free of lady Wachter‚Äôs undead that she will summon using Strahd‚Äôs book of death she received during their Dinner at castle Ravenloft ([Dinner with Strahd](https://www.notion.so/Dinner-with-Strahd-103263699129800dbb51d9ee709b0044?pvs=21)) / Zerio‚Äôs silver dragon shield should become Animated Shield, carried in the past by Argynvost himself - Although the mountains prevent the beacon's light from reaching Castle Ravenloft directly, Strahd can see the light's glow in the sky to the west. The beacon can be seen in Vallaki (*chapter 5*), Krezk (*chapter 8*), and Berez (*chapter 10*), as well as from Old Bonegrinder (*chapter 6*), Van Richten's Tower (*chapter 11*), and the werewolf den (*chapter 15*). The beacon's light can be "felt" even by creatures that are blind. The light allows good-aligned creatures to experience glimmers of hope and joy, while evil creatures find the light disconcerting. - ***Beacon of Protection.*** While the beacon shines, characters and other creatures that oppose Strahd gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws for as long as they remain in Barovia. - ***Revenants at Rest.*** **Vladimir Horngaard** and the other revenants that haunt Barovia see the light as a reminder of all that was once good and noble about the knightly order to which they once belonged. They let go of their hatred and their corporeal bodies, leaving corpses behind as their spirits find rest at long last. Henceforth, any random encounter with a revenant should be treated as no encounter. - By restoring the fanes to power including the Argynvostholt beacon > permanent overcast above Barovia dissipades > Everyone can see the moon, stars and sun now > Vampires do not have the power to walk the land in the daylight now and will be destroyed in the daylight - **Ezmeralda**, is on her way to the Wizard‚Äôs tower location where she continues her search for doctor Rudolph von Richter / she is destined to help the party, but she needs to find Rudolph and then based on his investigation plot her way to the Abbey of Markovia as she heard Abbot who can be a great ally > ultimately this will not go as planned, but it will reveal the Holy Symbol of Ravenkind - [Grimoire of Crimson](https://www.notion.so/Grimoire-of-Crimson-19626369912980a4856fef0721cb1fa0?pvs=21) - as the party kills hot blooded creatures it feeds the grimoire to power - Vampyr, the 1st vampire and the Dark Power that brought Barovia into Ravenloft, created this tome and through it, Vampyr seduces others to vampirism - Grimore speaks his ‚Äútruths‚Äù [Grimoire of Crimson](https://www.notion.so/Grimoire-of-Crimson-19626369912980a4856fef0721cb1fa0?pvs=21) - **the berry doesn‚Äôt permiate magic energy**; anything **lower** and the land corrupts this edible - the berries turn out **black and clearly rotten** *(and if consumed they make you throw up, reduce your HP by 1 and require you to eat soon or gain a level of exhaustion)* 7. The food can go bad - roll on 1d4 - 1d12 (depending on the quality of preservation) if it makes sense, on 1 it goes bad and is unsuitable to eat 8. Add comfort of the downtime rules: - suffer penalties, in case no quarter = cannot take effect of long rest in bad weather, can use only 1 downtime instead of 2 during long rest in any weather - use your background to find appropriate place (e.g. a temple, farmstead, noble) - roll to find one such place (DC15 appropriate skill, e.g. survival, charisma/social, wisdom, intellect - roll once per party) - *basic (usually 1SP/day) for basic living, most of the standard rooms has this (no bonuses or penalties)* - *comfortable (usually 1gp/day) for fine living (you can gain effects of one downtime for free)* - *luxureous (usually 5GP/day) for noble living (gain 2 luck points in the beginning of the day; then select:you can gain effects of one downtime for free and recover all your HP* - *OR gain effects of one downtime for free and fully recover HD* - *OR roll to gain a social asset, e.g. favor with an NPC w/o using your downtime* 9. Add carousing and gambling from Knave 2E! 10. I have introduced the fact - if you want to change your spells for the day - you need to use the downtime 11. Use downtime to level up - regain HP total of the difference between the maximum HP of previous level and new level - **Druids of the Fanes** - protectors of the land / Corrupted druids of Barovia - land is now Strahd, they worship Strahd - **Church of the Morninglord** - pieceful but not in alignment with magic of the fanes and nature - with common enemy in Strahd - **Order of the Silver Dragon** - protectors of Barovia and its people // completely destroyed, only sullen revenants remain - **Keepers of the Feather** - eyes and ears of the Order of the Silver Dragon / Kasimir thinks they are hiding - **Dusk Elves** of Barovia - see [Kasimir Velikov (6)](https://www.notion.so/Kasimir-Velikov-6-3db6f2a052b5456b8de822d45a61f434?pvs=21) - **Pagan Tergs** were never friends of the land, but they were lesser of the evil - driven away back to the South centuries ago 6. The party discovers some grim truths about Vallaki and Barovia - the Baron Valakovich is a despot, that organizes these festivals to keep the populace in check / Izek is the captain of the Baron‚Äôs militia - a formidable and dreadful fellow - Father Petrovich is managing the St. Andral‚Äôs church - he‚Äôs been a welcoming light in the darkness that persists around Barovia - There are many orphans in the city - Toad and Jorik among them (although Toad was adopted by the Araseks) - however, many children missing in the recent time - also reenforced by the missing children posters all over the town - Vallaki Vistani leave outside the town and are not allowed inside Vallaki by the town authorities; there‚Äôs a power struggle - a coup is planned by the brother of the current leader (Arigail together with Zintori plotting against Luvash) - There were protectors of Barovia: druids of the Starry Fanes (dusk elves part of them); Order of the Silver Dragon (destroyed and left for revenants in the Argynvostholt; Keepers of the Feather (presumed still in Barovia, in hiding) 7. Arigail is being manipulated by Anastrasya as she needs to replenish the [The Fallen Scourge Vampires (6)](https://www.notion.so/The-Fallen-Scourge-Vampires-6-13b263699129808b976dc67da472c6f2?pvs=21) 8. 2xvials of Teriac (cure for the infection) [Teriac Potion](https://www.notion.so/Teriac-Potion-1a4263699129800d83a7d6fd8717b68f?pvs=21) 9. Abbey restoration (**Abbots Treasury left behind>> Three bulky, cumbersome paintings** of immense value, each worth **500 gp (cannot carry it with them).) // is Abbot himself?** 10. Doru and Father Petrovich becom Strahds agents and leave in his castle for now 11. Bluto released from his infection and addiction to the black barm ale 12. Brother Antonio / brother Bertram / The door / portal to Gorgoroth world (outside the Brewery) / treasures of the Abbey 13. Walpole sr. - the bookstore owner - offers the party to browse his bookstore / he isn‚Äôt opening up on his ‚Äúsecret library‚Äù - only after the party become good friends with him 14. Blue Water Inn and Rictavio 15. The Barovian Vistani trio are scheming to still the Cat Tiara from the party 16. *Wael: Glamoured Studded Leather: winter clothes; resistance to piercing* 17. Burgomaster‚Äôs mansion can be used as a base of operation by the party - however, if not maintained by anyone for more than a couple of days - it will be occupied by either other villagers, monsters or worse (they broken some of the windows - so squatting people or wilderness is reasonable) 18. The party‚Äôs equipment and Bildrath store and Perriwimple 19. The party (Tuka attuned to the Cat Tiara) gained a familiar black abberation cat-like creature, strange tiara and an othewordly puzzle box that come with it - the cat will follow the party and act as a familiar; if killed it will retreat into the tiara as a smoky apparation; it‚Äôs not clear what this cat is // *The box itself bleeds strong acid when manipulated to open; acid looses potency if removed from the surface of the box almost immediately (5d8 acid damage) // The tiara is the cats totem and serves as a extradimensional safe space it can escape to (the party member attuned to it, can summon it back once per day/long rest)* 20. Cat Tiara and the abomination cat 21. Some optional NPCs the party knows from their travels: ~~Piotr and Ivan (Vallaki graverobbers),~~ Petra (Tser Vistani merchant), Dossyir (Silver Dragon revenant - in wait in the Svalich Woods near the village of Barovia for the final attack on Ravenloft), sceletal rider (of Silver Dragon), Morgantha, Zentori / Lungari, etc. 22. The party has gained Ring of Warmth from Petra 23. ~~Tinkertop severed his own hand due to unimaginable pain - his plan to regrow / reforge the hand~~ 24. ~~Tinkertop vaguely knows the true nature of the cat and the magical tiara - a world of its own inside it (Astral plane)~~ 25. ~~Tinkertop disappered during the burgomaster funeral attack - stantched by Strahd himself~~ 26. ~~Castor disappered when he stepped into the mists of Ravenloft - snatched by the Dark Powers, as one with sould unpure~~ -

Use downtime to level up - regain HP total of the difference between the maximum HP of previous level and new level - **Druids of the Fanes** - protectors of the land / Corrupted druids of Barovia - land is now Strahd, they worship Strahd - **Church of the Morninglord** - pieceful but not in alignment with magic of the fanes and nature - with common enemy in Strahd - **Order of the Silver Dragon** - protectors of Barovia and its people // completely destroyed, only sullen revenants remain - **Keepers of the Feather** - eyes and ears of the Order of the Silver Dragon / Kasimir thinks they are hiding - **Dusk Elves** of Barovia - see [Kasimir Velikov (6)](https://www.notion.so/Kasimir-Velikov-6-3db6f2a052b5456b8de822d45a61f434?pvs=21) - **Pagan Tergs** were never friends of the land, but they were lesser of the evil - driven away back to the South centuries ago 6. Arigail is being manipulated by Anastrasya as she needs to replenish the [The Fallen Scourge Vampires (6)](https://www.notion.so/The-Fallen-Scourge-Vampires-6-13b263699129808b976dc67da472c6f2?pvs=21) 8. 2xvials of Teriac (cure for the infection) [Teriac Potion](https://www.notion.so/Teriac-Potion-1a4263699129800d83a7d6fd8717b68f?pvs=21) 9. Abbey restoration (**Abbots Treasury left behind>> Three bulky, cumbersome paintings** of immense value, each worth **500 gp (cannot carry it with them).) // is Abbot himself?** 10. Brother Antonio / brother Bertram / The door / portal to Gorgoroth world (outside the Brewery) / treasures of the Abbey 13. barovian_time: Day 23: 8th of Avgust (2am) - Day 24: 9th of Avgust (11:10am) year 735 of Barovian Calendar
location: edge of Krezk > Krezk > Abbey of st. Markovia > Vallaki
summary: - reaching the edge of Krezk the party approaches the village gates and negotiate with the local burgomaster **Dmitri** Krezkov who asks for a wagon-load of wine from the Wizard of Wines to prove their good intention before they will be granted entry - the party decides to rather intimidate the Krezkovites, and gain entry through force - Dmitri Krezkov tells his people to stand down and ignore the party as much as they can - the party scouts and moves ahead towards the Abbey of st. Markovia - there they encounter the mongreloflk - in different stages of modification and madness - in the Abbey of st. Markovia they also find the grave of st. Petrovna (in the graveyard area) - with a sun indentation looking like something can be fitted into - inside the Abbey of st. Markovia they find the charismatic but somewhat mad Abbot, who predicted the party's entry - his creation Vasilka is a macabre if somewhat beautiful construct needs a wedding dress to prepare her for mariage with Strahd - the Abbot beleives that this is the only way to lift the curse over Barovia and release its people and Strahd from this prison; for this he promises to grant them anything they desire + the party also note there's a sun-shaped amulet on the neck of Vasilka - the party asks permission and visits the upper floor of the Abbey - as beautiful music flows from there - they find a two-headed mongrelfolk Colvin who plays a one-stringed viol and rings the Abbey's bell, while drinking intently the wine; he is helpful if somewhat servile - he tells the story of Belviews and how the Abbot changed them to cure their curse of madness, while also granting them extended life (he's the proof that it works) - the party then proceeds into the other wing of the Abbey and encounter a lone rogue searching around - Ezmerelda d'Avenir - the one profesized by madam Eva to be an ally against Strahd; they agree to meetup outside Krezk - They meetup with Ezmerelda outside Krezk and then proceed to Vallaki, they reach Vallaki in the morning. - **The Holy Symbol of Ravenkind** and Vasilka /the Abbot >> inside the Abbey of st. Markovia they find the charismatic but somewhat mad Abbot, who predicted the party's entry - his creation Vasilka is a macabre if somewhat beautiful construct needs a wedding dress to prepare her for mariage with Strahd - the Abbot beleives that this is the only way to lift the curse over Barovia and release its people and Strahd from this prison; for this he promises to grant them anything they desire ![](https://t90151211099.p.clickup-attachments.com/t90151211099/9ba5f916-4484-487e-a42e-83f54949b260/image.png) - the party then proceeds into the other wing of the Abbey and encounter a lone rogue searching around - **Ezmerelda d'Avenir** the one profesized by madam Eva to be an ally against Strahd. he will be added to Strahds spawn army) - **11th Avgust:** They get to X30 where they find a library of empty books, they store Crimson Grimoire under the protective enchantment of the Amber Library -
